Hostname.description: This Gateway's hostname (used when inferring external URLs).

ProvisionerPublicKeyFile.description: Path to the provisioner public key which is used to verify tokens without any specific restriction.

ProvisionerPrivateKeyFile.description: Path to the provisioner private key which is used to generate session tokens when using the standalone web application.

SubProvisionerPublicKey.description: A JSON object describing the sub provisioner public key which may only be used to verify tokens when establishing a session.

DelegationPrivateKeyFile.description: Path to the delegation private key which is used to decipher sensitive data from tokens.

TlsCertificateFile.description: Path to the certificate to use for TLS.

TlsPrivateKeyFile.description: Path to the private key to use for TLS.

TlsPrivateKeyPassword.description: Password to use for decrypting the TLS private key.

TlsCertificateSubjectName.description: Subject name of the certificate to use for TLS when using system source.

TlsCertificateStoreName.description: Name of the System Certificate Store to use for TLS (default is 'My').

TlsCertificateStoreLocation.description: Location of the System Certificate Store to use for TLS.

Ngrok.description: JSON object describing the ngrok configuration for ingress listeners.

WebApp.description: JSON object describing the standalone web application configuration.

AiGateway.description: JSON object describing the AI gateway configuration (experimental, requires enable_unstable).

Format.description: The format used for the key data.

Encoding.description: The binary-to-text encoding used for the key data.

Format.description: The format used for the key data.

Encoding.description: The binary-to-text encoding used for the key data.

DataEncoding.description: The binary-to-text encoding used for the key data.

PubKeyFormat.description: The format used for the key data.

PrivKeyFormat.description: The format used for the key data.

Id.description: The key ID for this subkey.

Format.description: The format used for the key data.

Encoding.description: The binary-to-text encoding used for the key data.

CertStoreLocation.description: Location of the System Certificate Store to use for TLS.

Url.description: HTTP URL where notification messages are to be sent.

Token.description: Bearer token to use when making HTTP requests.

AuthToken.description: Specifies the authentication token used to connect to the ngrok service.

HeartbeatInterval.description: How often the service should heartbeat to the ngrok servers defined as a number in seconds.

HeartbeatTolerance.description: Reconnect the agent tunnel session if the server does not respond to a heartbeat within this tolerance defined as a number in seconds.

Metadata.description: Opaque, user-supplied string that will be returned as part of the ngrok API response to the list online sessions resource for all tunnels started by Devolutions Gateway service.

ServerAddr.description: This is the URL of the ngrok server to connect to. You should only set this if you are using a custom ingress URL.

Tunnels.description: A map of ngrok tunnels. The key is the name of the tunnel and value is a JSON object whose schema depends on tunnel protocol.

RemoteAddr.description: Bind the remote TCP address and port, as registered in the ngrok dashboard.

Metadata.description: Arbitrary user-defined metadata that will appear in the ngrok service API when listing tunnel sessions.

AllowCidrs.description: Array of CIDRs, rejects connections that do not match the given CIDRs.

DenyCidrs.description: Array of CIDRs, rejects connections that match the given CIDRs and allows all other CIDRs.

Domain.description: The domain to request, as registered in the ngrok dashboard.

Metadata.description: Arbitrary user-defined metadata that will appear in the ngrok service API when listing tunnel sessions.

CircuitBreaker.description: Reject requests when 5XX responses exceed this ratio.

Compression.description: Enable gzip compression for HTTP responses.

AllowCidrs.description: Array of CIDRs, rejects connections that do not match the given CIDRs.

DenyCidrs.description: Array of CIDRs, rejects connections that match the given CIDRs and allows all other CIDRs.

Enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable the standalone web application.

Authentication.description: The authentication method for accessing the web application.

AppTokenMaximumLifetime.description: The maximum lifetime granted to web application tokens defined as a number in seconds (default is 28800 for 8 hours).

LoginLimitRate.description: The maximum number of login requests for a given username/IP pair over a minute (default is 10).

UsersFile.description: Path to the users file which holds the list of users authorized to access the web application when using the 'Custom' authentication method (default is 'users.txt').

StaticRootPath.description: Path to the static files for the standalone web application. This is an advanced option which should typically not be changed.

WebAppAuth.description: The authentication method for accessing the web application.

Enabled.description: Whether to enable the AI gateway feature.

GatewayApiKey.description: API key for authenticating requests to the AI gateway.

RequestTimeoutSecs.description: Request timeout in seconds (default is 300 for 5 minutes).

Endpoint.description: Custom Mistral API endpoint (default is https://api.mistral.ai). Can be overridden with MISTRAL_API_ENDPOINT environment variable.

ApiKey.description: Mistral API key. Can be overridden with MISTRAL_API_KEY environment variable.

Endpoint.description: Custom Ollama API endpoint (default is http://localhost:11434). Can be overridden with OLLAMA_API_ENDPOINT environment variable.

ApiKey.description: Ollama API key (optional). Can be overridden with OLLAMA_API_KEY environment variable.

Endpoint.description: Custom LM Studio API endpoint (default is http://localhost:1234). Can be overridden with LMSTUDIO_API_ENDPOINT environment variable.

ApiKey.description: LM Studio API key (optional). Can be overridden with LMSTUDIO_API_KEY environment variable.

Endpoint.description: Custom Anthropic API endpoint (default is https://api.anthropic.com). Can be overridden with ANTHROPIC_API_ENDPOINT environment variable.

ApiKey.description: Anthropic API key. Can be overridden with ANTHROPIC_API_KEY environment variable.

Endpoint.description: Custom OpenAI API endpoint (default is https://api.openai.com). Can be overridden with OPENAI_API_ENDPOINT environment variable.

ApiKey.description: OpenAI API key. Can be overridden with OPENAI_API_KEY environment variable.

Endpoint.description: Custom OpenRouter API endpoint (default is https://openrouter.ai/api). Can be overridden with OPENROUTER_API_ENDPOINT environment variable.

ApiKey.description: OpenRouter API key. Can be overridden with OPENROUTER_API_KEY environment variable.

ResourceName.description: Azure OpenAI resource name (e.g., 'my-resource'). The full URL will be https://{ResourceName}.openai.azure.com. Can be overridden with AZURE_OPENAI_RESOURCE_NAME environment variable.

DeploymentId.description: Azure OpenAI deployment ID for the model. Can be overridden with AZURE_OPENAI_DEPLOYMENT_ID environment variable.

ApiKey.description: Azure OpenAI API key. Can be overridden with AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY environment variable.

ApiVersion.description: Azure OpenAI API version (default is 2024-02-15-preview). Can be overridden with AZURE_OPENAI_API_VERSION environment variable.
